artifact_name: textile; cloth(a; c; d; e; f); garment; tunic(? b only)
Description: 6 Textile fragments of plain weave [warp-faced simple tabby] linen: a - Tattered rectangle of undyed linen cloth; medium quality; no original edges; traces of resin. Threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.30 ends per 10mm and weft 16 picks per 10mm. b - Fragment of undyed linen tunic(?); fine quality; remains of seam along one side, probably joining two selvedges. Edges hidden in the seam; other edges torn and ragged. Threads are S-spun and infrequently S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.38 ends per 10mm and weft 26 picks per 10mm. c - Long irregular fragment of undyed linen cloth (now grey-cream in colour); medium quality; no original edges. Threads are S-spun and occasionally S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.30 ends per 10mm and weft 18 picks per 10mm. d - Long irregular fragment of undyed linen cloth (now grey-cream in colour); medium quality; no original edges. Threads are S-spun and S-spliced with lots of overspinning; splices are few and far between; the stitch gauge is warp c.29 ends per 10mm and weft 17 picks per 10mm. e - Irregular fragment of undyed linen cloth; fine quality; now cream coloured with darker stains. Edges torn or ragged. Threads are S-spun and a little splicing; lots of overspinning; the stitch gauge is warp c.48 ends per 10mm and weft 23 picks per 10mm. f - Small fragment of undyed linen cloth rolled lengthways; fine quality, now light tan in colour. No original edges. Threads are S-spun and occasionally S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.70 ends per 10mm and weft 12 picks per 10mm.
Curator's comments: Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992] a: resin is possibly a sign of a relatively late date. b-f: found in same box as 6513a [originally just 6513]; these pieces do not seem to have originally belonged together because only one piece is mentioned by Birch. Although b-f are probably not associated with a, they may belong together as a group.
